Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`mykey ..is just a random string I put there... according to the command help ..`
the "random string" would come *after* the key as an account name, if you didn't put the key before that then that's why it errored

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
you wrote that you did `./komodo-cli -ac_name=RICK importprivkey "mykey"`
and that you just put in a random string
Unless I read wrong, that's why you got an error
it must be
`./komodo-cli -ac_name=RICK importprivkey theKeyHere "accountNameHere"`

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: account name is best left as just "" because most of the account features are no longer used

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: the actual key, there is no "name of the key"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @coinmonks || CoinCodeCap @gcharang FYI 1 pubkey actually corresponds to TWO addresses (one compressed, one uncompressed), which really represent the same public key integer in two different formats. Both are 2 different valid addresses for the pubkey. Each format of the pubkey still corresponds to ONE single private key. This comes from BTC, not anything special to KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: In case things were too simple for you 游땎
